title: rclone dedupe --fast-list does not dedupe
body:
Hi there!

I suppose that the following behaviour is unintended and should be considered a bug:

```
~ >>> rclone dedupe --dry-run --fast-list -vv Gsuite:test
2019/01/09 17:27:03 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "dedupe" "--dry-run" "--fast-list" "-vv" "Gsuite:test"]
2019/01/09 17:27:03 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/oqpvc/.rclone.conf"
2019/01/09 17:27:22 INFO  : Google drive root 'test': Looking for duplicates using interactive mode.
2019/01/09 17:27:29 INFO  : dedupetest: NOT Merging contents of duplicate directories as --dry-run
2019/01/09 17:28:07 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
2019/01/09 17:28:07 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "dedupe" "--dry-run" "--fast-list" "-vv" "Gsuite:test"]
~ >>> rclone dedupe --dry-run  -vv Gsuite:test
2019/01/09 17:28:50 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "dedupe" "--dry-run" "-vv" "Gsuite:test"]
2019/01/09 17:28:50 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/oqpvc/.rclone.conf"
2019/01/09 17:29:07 INFO  : Google drive root 'test': Looking for duplicates using interactive mode.
2019/01/09 17:29:10 INFO  : dedupetest: NOT Merging contents of duplicate directories as --dry-run
2019/01/09 17:29:30 NOTICE: dedupetest/foo.epub: Found 2 duplicates - deleting identical copies
2019/01/09 17:29:30 NOTICE: dedupetest/foo.epub: Deleting 1/2 identical duplicates (MD5 "fd35982146610378a240a276fb88c69f")
2019/01/09 17:29:30 NOTICE: dedupetest/foo.epub: Not deleting as --dry-run
2019/01/09 17:29:30 NOTICE: dedupetest/foo.epub: All duplicates removed
2019/01/09 17:29:30 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
2019/01/09 17:29:30 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "dedupe" "--dry-run" "-vv" "Gsuite:test"]
```

The directory `test` contains two directories of the same name `dedupetest`, the first containing a single file and the second containing a single file `foo.epub` twice.

I guess that somewhere in the implementation of `--fast-list` there is an implicit assumption that path names are unique identifiers, a rather silly idea if you ask whoever is in charge of Google Drive.

This makes deduplication considerably less useful: Without `--fast-list`, `rclone dedupe Gsuite:/` will reach the Google rate limit in no time.
